page.title: 12RECREATION IN MOTE PARK
page.content: Occupying 226 hectares of picturesque meadows and woodland, Mote Park caters for many recreational tastes, such as: {A miniature railway {Lake with fishing/sailing facilities {Pitch-and-putt course {3 rugby pitches and 2 soccer pitches {Cross-country running courses {A public indoor swimming centre {3 children's play areas. Nature walks are made popular by the variety of wildlife and flora (p.14). It is the largest public park within a 40-mile radius and has been used since the mid-18th century. Part of it was formerly the County showground, and there are several historical features including the 17th-century Mote House, now a Cheshire Home (781551).{The Mote {Cricket and Squash Club}shares with{ {Maidstone Rugby Club}a separate ground within the original western boundary.
